Put a randomised sotto voce giggle in there without telling anyone

Space madnessssssss

I got this weird bug right after I put this in, it seems to be connected with Kethane mod, I am Kethane-0.9.2.

After I put Chatterer in and it appears in the stock toolbar, this is what happens. I go to launch a ship, Look on top right. I can enable Blizzy toolbar option, but for the error to go away I have to completely back out of save game and come back in. After this point it works fine.

Here is picture after I back out of save after enabling Blizzy Toolbar:

When I disable Blizzy Toolbar and it goes back to stock tool bar it does it again. It appears in all the scenes as you can see here.

This is my mod list so far:

Well hope this helps.

Seriously ? ^^

Edited October 10, 2014 by protonv

I got this weird bug right after I put this in, it seems to be connected with Kethane mod, I am Kethane-0.9.2.

After I put Chatterer in and it appears in the stock toolbar, this is what happens. I go to launch a ship, Look on top right. I can enable Blizzy toolbar option, but for the error to go away I have to completely back out of save game and come back in. After this point it works fine.

...

Well hope this helps.

Thanks for your report.

By looking at your log files I think I get where the issue comes from, Chatterer button may try to be initialized before ApplicationLauncher's readiness.

I will implement a additional "ready" check in the next version, hopefully it will fix this.

Chatterer doesn't work in my Linux. Game stop loading. I dont have any crash report folder.

If I delete in GameData/Chatterer/Sounds/ folder chatter the game runs correct and rest of plug-in works fine ( beeps,wind,background sounds).

(Linux 3.13.0-37-generic #64-Ubuntu i686 GNU/Linux)

I found an issue with Chatterer 0.7.1 on KSP 0.25 (Linux, 64 bit) where selecting a different skin for its windows will work fine until restarting the game. After that KSP.log will be spammed with

[EXC 14:35:42.006] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
Parameter name: index
    System.Collections.Generic.List`1[UnityEngine.GUISkin].get_Item (Int32 index)
    Chatterer.chatterer.draw_GUI ()
    RenderingManager.OnGUI ()

and a lot of dialogs won't show while flying a mission, including stock things like the science pop-ups. I was able to fix it by setting

skin_index = 1

in GameData/Chatterer/Plugins/PluginData/Chatterer/plugin.cfg

Thanks for your report.

By looking at your log files I think I get where the issue comes from, Chatterer button may try to be initialized before ApplicationLauncher's readiness.

I will implement a additional "ready" check in the next version, hopefully it will fix this.

@Athlonic it appears that bug is related to Kethane mod. I removed Chatterer and the problem is still there, I also went over to Kethane forums thread and there are some issues I have.

@ Kshade

That is interesting, does it happen with every skin or only some of them ?

Also if you set "skin_index = 0" does it fix the problem as well ?

@ Therealcrow999

Yep I saw this in the Kethane thread, I had this issue once but was unable to reproduce it then after.
I'm sure you've heard this a million times before but this is an awesome mod that should be on anyone's "must have" list. It adds so more immersion to the game! THANK YOU!!
Is it possibly to use this Version in 24.2 ?

Is it possibly to use this Version in 24.2 ?

Don't know.

As long as you don't use the latest RemoteTech (no more called RT2) you better stay with Chatterer v0.7.0, as there are no new features beside this, just to be on the safe side

Been enjoying this mod right from the start of my KSP experiance. Now I see integration with Remote Tech. Awesome and great job!

NASA just released a bunch more audio clips on their soundcloud page. It'd be great to see some of these Kerbalized and added into the mod. Been using Chatterer for so long I pretty much have all the sound bytes memorized.

Hey there, firstly much thanks for providing this awesome mod.

I'm having a weird issue where many of the windows don't show up( for this and some other mods, including science reports too).

I don't know if this general or specific so I posted on modded support, however checking on KSP.log I've found a lot spamming:

[EXC 23:32:09.484] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
Parameter name: index
	System.Collections.Generic.List`1[UnityEngine.GUISkin].get_Item (Int32 index)
	Chatterer.chatterer.draw_GUI ()
	RenderingManager.OnGUI ()
[EXC 23:32:09.485] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
Parameter name: index
	System.Collections.Generic.List`1[UnityEngine.GUISkin].get_Item (Int32 index)
	Chatterer.chatterer.draw_GUI ()
	RenderingManager.OnGUI ()
[EXC 23:32:09.535] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
Parameter name: index
	System.Collections.Generic.List`1[UnityEngine.GUISkin].get_Item (Int32 index)
	Chatterer.chatterer.draw_GUI ()
	RenderingManager.OnGUI ()
[EXC 23:32:09.536] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
Parameter name: index
	System.Collections.Generic.List`1[UnityEngine.GUISkin].get_Item (Int32 index)
	Chatterer.chatterer.draw_GUI ()
	RenderingManager.OnGUI ()

This goes on pretty much all the flight time, this could be causing some lag and maybe preventing other windows of showing up?

Any ideas what this means? Cheers

Is it normal to continue hearing kerbals speeching even when I don't have a Remote Tech connection (only on manned missions)?

Chatterer and Remote Tech are latest version.

KSP 0.25 32 bit on win 64 bit.

@Gfurst : Sorry I can't reproduce this issue here. Did you try to set another UI skin to see if the problem persist ?

Is it normal to continue hearing kerbals speeching even when I don't have a Remote Tech connection (only on manned missions)?

Chatterer and Remote Tech are latest version.

KSP 0.25 32 bit on win 64 bit.

Yep sometimes Kerbal will try to chatter even if there is no connection (red icon), however you should not hear any capcom's answers (blue icon) but only capsule emissions (green icon).

Ok this is my first mod and its not working. Its not playing and beeps or chatter. I get the menus. does it have to be a new game and not a saved one? When I reloaded the game at first it didn't show a "chatter" button in the GUI. Its the STEAM .25 version on WIN 7.

Any ideas? Thanks
